author: jstrachan
msg: Switched the default to be that elements are used for primitive type properties. This seems a much more common use case. Users can always switch it back programatically on the XMLIntrospector.setAttributesForPrimitives(true) or via the .betwixt file.

author: jstrachan
msg: Applied patch for better handling of primitive types in a consistent manner.

author: jstrachan
msg: Patched Betwixt to be able to properly default Digester rules auto-detecting addFoo(Foo) methods. This means that Betwixt can now bidirectionally turn the RSS example beans into XML and parse it back into beans. I've added round tripping JUnit test cases to ensure that Betwixt behaves like the RSSDigester example as well as that round tripping to XML then beans doesn't loose any information. Also updated the documentation somewhat to describe the addFoo() method naming conventions. Also removed the TODO.txt as the updated STATUS.html now contains a complete list of things to do. Finally some release notes have been added to CVS.

author: rdonkin
msg: For users which really don't want IDs added to their elements, i've added a property which disables this and instead throws a CyclicReferenceException runtime whenever a cyclic reference is encountered in the graph. The default is still to use ID/IDREFs.

author: rdonkin
msg: Removed bits and pieces left over from first ID-IDREF implementation strategy
